content.label:
I would liken the experience with that of playing with a piece of interactive art. 

You play through several levels or windows where you experiment with the objects and backgrounds in each one to solve a sort of mystery puzzle, the end result is you get a little block key to unlock the door to the next window.

But the most fun is in interacting and figuring out what everything does and how it all works together.
Great APP...need to make some more!

This is so cool! I love the art style and the creativity, this app opens up an amazing world and it's just AWESOME!!! I want to play more levels though, it's just so amazing and I want to see even more!
If you read my comment, thanks for listening:)

This is one of my favorite point and click games. Despite its short gameplay, I'd go as far to say that I'd pay a full dollar per level if I had to. I have replayed this game several times since I first played this as a flash game.
Would be a great game but it was way too short. Easily done in well under an hour and for $3 that isn't worth it. Beautiful, but needs a lot more levels for the value.

None of the pictures with the description are actually of things in the game. There is only one environment. I've tapped, dragged, double-tapped, touched every single thing in that environment and absolutely NOTHING opens up to allow more exploration. The game is over in about a minute. Not anywhere NEAR worth the money. BOOO!
I loved playing this game, but for $2.99, I expect the game to last more than five minutes.
Please make more scenes!  Charming, thoughtful game.  A little like Hamlet, another favorite and similar.
A very sweet and clever game. Fun for adults to explore and solve with kids.
Truly beautiful and imaginative game. Short, but something I will play again and definitely share with others.
This is definitely the most amazing game I have ever played. It is just the best thing to do in your free time or when you need to stay occupied. Totally recommend this to EVERYONE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Fun but too short... Not worth the $$$
Very creative game. Challenging, inventive and audacious. My whole family enjoyed it. (My 11year old daughter had to help me in places.) ;-)

title.label: Truly a standout unique game. Not a kids game. It's amazing

content.label: I almost never take the time to write reviews but this one warrants the time. It is truly an amazing work of art that pushes standard concepts of what a game is and should do. It's so engaging and different that it really stands out in the ever growing sea of games out there. I only wish it kept going. I look forward to more games or levels added to this one in the future.
Too short, too easy. 15 min not worth the $
The graphic design is amazing. It is as simple as this- it is the best app I own but it needs more levels
Amazing, gripping, challenging, inventive--the only problem is that we're still waiting on the next Vectorpark creation! Kudos to the team...
Would buy every sequel without hesitation. Please make more...

I ABSOLUTLY S
LOVE THIS GAME but it only has 10 
Levels hopefully ull add some

Thank you to the reviewer who said we should not be fooled by the animations into thinking this was a kid's game.  I have honestly ignored this game for months for precisely that reason.  I know better now.  It is simply beautiful.  I haven't yet finished it, so can't comment on its length.  I know now, though, that is unique, polished, creative, and clever.  I also know I already want a sequel.  Well done!
This is one of those games where you are so sad that is over! I hope there is more to come
This is really half-way between a puzzle and a work of art.  Highly inventive, and well worth playing.
This game is a short interactive art piece. It is really great. The artwork and smoothness of animation and the strange and humorous world are very compelling.

Unique and wonderful....please make more!!!
Ace-
Really like the aesthetic of this game and I had a great time playing it (as did my 7-year-old son). Only wish it was longer‚Ä¶

The game is fun, graphics are interesting. Feels like an interactive book.  It is too short, however.  I completed the entire experience in less than an hour.  A little too highly priced at 3 bucks, more likely worth a dollar.
So imaginative.  I loved playing it and my kids still love to run through it every now and then.  I wish there were more apps like it!

title.label: Impossible to quantify, but leaves me impressed

content.label:
A deeply visceral experience, Windosill could easily qualify as a piece of interactive art, but an incredible amount of work has gone into making every interaction natural and FUN! whether you love it or leave disappointed depends entirely on how much you enjoy tinkering with a surreal world, because it's largely the tinkering, not the actual problem solving, that is the whole point. Everything is so responsive in such a natural way.

While the game is certainly a bit short, I found it somewhat challenging and full of crazy awesome experiences. Would love to buy a sequel.

This is easily the best game I have on my iPad. The design is beautiful and surreal, and you never know whats coming next. It truly is beautiful. I can't wait for another version of this labyrinth-like, imaginative, dreamy world.
This took all of 30 minutes to complete. It felt more like a demo than a $3 app.
Great but short!
Coolest puzzle game I've seen out there and the ways it moves is pretty awesome but unfortunately it only took like 40 minutes to beat it. Maybe more levels? Worth $2.99 though.
Love it,but it is too short.
The absolutely delightful feeling you get when experiencing Windosill is worth twice the cost. Great great great.

This feels like the sort of game Nintendo would make for the iPad. 
There's a slight nod to wario ware but only in passing. 

It's fun, smart and beautiful. 

The art work perfectly matches the playful nature of the puzzles and  coupled with pleasing tough controls it's a joy to play

The game is short in fundamental terms but it feels satisfying as there are no boring moments.

I played it twice back to back and can see self fiddling with it in the future. It's toy-like nature may provide replay value particularly for younger ones.

As an adult,  I'd play it non stop if they release some more.

Fun game pretty good puzzles. All around clever. I would rate the actual game play five stars, but the game was waaaaaaaaay too short for the money. So short I finished the whole game in way under an hour. That is totally unacceptable for the price! It's a pretty good game but I feel totally ripped off...

I have played dozens of games; a few (very few) of them were outstanding; but this one is as perfect as it gets. It's clever, original, creative, artistically brilliant, and fun. Although many games claim to be addictive, this one truly is; I couldn't stop playing. My only disappointment was that it was over too quickly and I want more, more, more.
I didn't really get it at first, but kept trying and loved it! Made me giggle...just needs more levels.
I thought this would be a game for days to come. But I finished it in 25 minutes. May be adding more levels would be great. Awesome,e design and style. Recommended for kids and curious adults.
I love the app but I finished it in an hour! So I really hope more levels come because if they don't it's not worth 3 dollars.
Ok I am a lame adult I love this so far but can't figure out puzzle number three with the five items on stems, the box opens and the flower opens but I cannot figure it out
Hands down the best game I've downloaded on my iPad.

title.label: Silly rabbit, windowsills is for adults too!

content.label:
I bought this on a recommendation and I am having a ball with it. Single sitting? I'm stuck on the 6th one. I need a kindergartner to help me through this. Vector art? There must be a clue there. 
Rewards your curiosity, puts you in the zone of imagination. Will look for more by this developer...

Fun, surprising, hard until you get it, and worth the effort. An art work as puzzle. I was sorry getting to the end.

Sidbin

4-1/2 stars - beautiful and immersive, but kind of short (took me an hour to play through)

The best part of this game is not the puzzles - they are not, in and of themselves, terribly difficult, if you are willing to be persistent - but the interactivity. There are characters on every screen - sweet, quirky, clever, and never threatening - that give the game an atmosphere of quiet playfulness. Exploring each scene is as much fun as solving the puzzle itself. I can see why this would give it great appeal to children - but I found it really lovely as an adult as well. I've spent far more on apps that have given me far less pleasure. Even short, this is well worth the money.
Excellent game! Now I want more levels! It's so addicting, excellent motions and everything is so smooth! üëçüëç
Huge smile on my face while playing. That's really all I have to say.

Don't be fooled by its kid-like characteristics; this is a game to be enjoyed by all ages. The attention to detail; well-thought design and characteristics of puzzle; sounds and creativity are what make this great.

My only complaint, as someone else already said, it ends! I hope that there will be updates, even if they're in-app purchases.
More, more, more! Please:)

title.label: I love it put a heart on it

content.label:
From my 4 year old Harlow:

I love a brand new game that's called darkness. I don't like the hand in that game. I just like the pages in it. I like you but I don't care about what you want me to do. I don't want you to boss me around and that's not fair.

Windowselled you gotta play this. There's like a big hand to fix the letters for us, it helps people and it tricks us. The car can go door to door. It never works until you know! I love it around here!

And I love it but I don't like when it tricks us because I was trying to pull it but it never works. I wanna try and pull that hand!
